abstract: U.S. companies are hoarding almost $1 trillion in cash, which they are more likely to spend on on share repurchases and mergers and acquisitions a the economy stabilizes, rather than expanding their business and hiring new employee, Moody’s Investors Service said on Tuesday.
snippet: U.S. companies are hoarding almost $1 trillion in cash, which they are more likely to spend on on share repurchases and mergers and acquisitions a the economy stabilizes, rather than expanding their business and hiring new employee, Moody’s Invest...
lead_paragraph: American companies are hoarding almost $1 trillion in cash, but are unlikely to spend on expanding their businesses and hiring new employees because of continuing uncertainty about the strength of the economy, Moody’s Investors Service says.

headline.main: U.S. Companies Hoarding Almost $1 Trillion in Cash

abstract: Windows Phone 7 is new phone software that Microsoft hopes will run on new phones from various manufacturers and cellular networks.
snippet: Windows Phone 7 is new phone software that Microsoft hopes will run on new phones from various manufacturers and cellular networks.
lead_paragraph: What on earth is Microsoft doing, bringing out its iPhone competitor now, in 2010?

headline.main: A Phone of Promise, With Flaws
headline.print_headline: A Phone Of Promise, With Flaws
